questions.question: What is the purpose of the rule of thirds in landscape composition?
choices: To divide the canvas into equal parts
To create a more dynamic and interesting composition
To emphasize the center of the drawing
questions.answer: To create a more dynamic and interesting composition

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key element of landscape composition?
What is atmospheric perspective?
choices: A technique to draw clouds accurately
A method to create the illusion of depth in landscapes
A way to measure air pressure in a scene
A tool for weather forecasting in art
questions.answer: A method to create the illusion of depth in landscapes

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a principle of atmospheric perspective?
What is the effect of atmospheric perspective on colors in distant objects?
choices: Colors become warmer and more saturated
Colors become cooler and less saturated
Colors become brighter and more vivid
questions.answer: Colors become cooler and less saturated

questions.question: What is the purpose of using leading lines in landscape composition?
choices: To create straight edges in the drawing
To guide the viewer's eye through the composition
To measure the distance between objects
To separate the foreground from the background
questions.answer: To guide the viewer's eye through the composition

questions.question: What is the focal point in a landscape composition?
choices: The brightest area of the drawing
The main point of interest in the composition
questions.answer: The main point of interest in the composition

questions.question: How does reducing detail contribute to atmospheric perspective?
choices: It makes distant objects appear closer
It increases the contrast in the background
It creates the illusion of depth by simplifying distant objects
questions.answer: It creates the illusion of depth by simplifying distant objects

questions.question: What is the effect of lowering the horizon line in a landscape composition?
choices: It creates a sense of claustrophobia

questions.question: Which technique is used to create the illusion of water reflections in landscape drawing?
What is the purpose of creating thumbnail sketches before starting a landscape drawing?
choices: To create a final product quickly

questions.question: How does the quality of light affect a landscape drawing?
choices: It has no effect on the drawing
It only affects the colors used
It defines forms, creates mood, and brings the scene to life
It only affects the shadows in the scene
questions.answer: It defines forms, creates mood, and brings the scene to life

questions.question: What is the effect of using softer, less defined lines for distant objects?
choices: It creates a sense of motion
It enhances the detail of distant objects
It increases the contrast in the background

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical element in a Timorese landscape?
How does high humidity in Timor-Leste affect atmospheric perspective in landscapes?
choices: It has no effect on atmospheric perspective
It eliminates the need for atmospheric perspective

questions.question: What is the purpose of overlapping shapes in landscape drawing?
Which of the following is a characteristic of the foreground in a landscape drawing?
What is the effect of placing the horizon line high in the composition?
choices: It creates a sense of vastness
It draws attention to the land or water below
questions.answer: It draws attention to the land or water below

questions.question: Which technique is useful for rendering the texture of tree bark in a landscape drawing?
What is the purpose of gradual lightening of values in atmospheric perspective?
choices: To make distant objects appear farther away
To add detail to background elements
questions.answer: To make distant objects appear farther away

questions.question: How does strong sunlight in Timor-Leste affect landscape drawings?
choices: It has no effect on the drawing

questions.question: What is the effect of using cooler colors for distant objects in a landscape?
choices: It creates the illusion of atmospheric depth
questions.answer: It creates the illusion of atmospheric depth

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical use of charcoal in landscape drawing?
What is the purpose of creating a value scale before starting a landscape drawing?
choices: To determine the size of the drawing

questions.question: How can an artist create the illusion of a winding path in a landscape drawing?
choices: By employing leading lines and varying width
By drawing it only in the foreground
By using only one value throughout
questions.answer: By employing leading lines and varying width

questions.question: What is the effect of drawing clouds with soft, blended edges?
choices: It makes them appear more solid
It creates a sense of movement and atmosphere
It increases their contrast with the sky
It flattens the perspective of the sky
questions.answer: It creates a sense of movement and atmosphere

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of drawing mountains in the distance?
What is the purpose of including human figures or animals in a landscape drawing?
choices: To distract from the natural elements
To cover up mistakes in the drawing
To make the drawing more colorful

questions.question: How can an artist create the illusion of mist or fog in a landscape drawing?
choices: By increasing contrast in the background
By softening edges and reducing detail in affected areas
By drawing sharp, clear lines throughout
questions.answer: By softening edges and reducing detail in affected areas

questions.question: What is the effect of using a wide range of values in a landscape drawing?
choices: It reduces the need for atmospheric perspective
